[[File:William Bowie by Robert Field NS Archives.jpeg|thumb|William Bowie, by [[Robert Field (painter)|Robert Field]]]] '''William Bowie''' (1783-1819) was a prominent merchant of [[Halifax, Nova Scotia]] who was killed in the last fatal duel on record in Nova Scotia.Brian Cuthbertson. The Old Attorney General: A Biography of Richard John Uniacke. Halifax: Nimbus Publishing, 1980, p. 76 At age 20, William Bowie arrived in Nova Scotia in 1803 from [[Inverness]], [[Scotland]]. He became president of the [[North British Society]]. Under the mentorship of [[Alexander Brymer]], Bowie founded the firm Bowie & DeBlois and in a few years amassed a fortune and Bowie became a leading citizen in Halifax.https://archive.org/stream/annalsnorthbri00nort#page/136/mode/1uphttp://www.biographi.ca/en/bio/deblois_stephen_wastie_7E.html == Duel == During a supreme court case in July 1819, Bowie's opposing lawyer was [[Richard John Uniacke, Jr.]] They both made insulting remarks to each other and Uniacke challenged Bowie to a duel.Cutherbertson reports that nature of Uniacke's charge against Bowie is unknown, however, it may have been about Bowie being arrested for smuggling (See [https://books.google.ca/books?id=BC2trqrpnwUC&pg=PA347&lpg=PA347&dq=%22william+bowie%22+halifax&source=bl&ots=DWhJzeWqix&sig=8rJPuX6rwEitgMxcRJwNcbwFdPE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiN663V2I_UAhUCJiYKHW5BA0oQ6AEIMDAC#v=onepage&q=%22william%20bowie%22%20halifax&f=false here]). They met near the Narrows at 4:00 am on July 21. They marched twelve paces from each other. Then they fired two shots, after which Bowie was taken to a nearby barn where he died. He was age 36. The duel and death of Bowie "shocked Halifax" and the flags of all the vessels in the harbour were hung at half mast.Cutherbertson, p. 76 This was the first important trial to happen in the court at [[Province House (Nova Scotia)|Province House]].https://books.google.ca/books?id=SvdGAQAAMAAJ&pg=RA1-PA190&lpg=RA1-PA190&dq=Bowie+%26+DeBlois++halifax&source=bl&ots=nW8S88e_CC&sig=bLiazE3mlZBrLe54sWuE0gT-iug&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjPjaH10Y3UAhWCLSYKHbvlB0MQ6AEIPjAE#v=onepage&q=Bowie%20%26%20DeBlois%20%20halifax&f=false The grand jury trial proved to be "screaming farce." https://archive.org/stream/annalsnorthbri00nort#page/139/mode/1up Such a trial would have normally been prosecuted by Uniacke's father [[Richard John Uniacke]] who was the attorney general, however, he declined. The drama of the trial was captured by the ''[[Acadian Recorder]]'':
:... about 20 minutes past 11 o'clock, the Hon. [[Richard John Uniacke]] entered the Court, supporting his son on his right arm... He advanced to the Bench and stated to the Court, under feeling which evidently almost overpowered him, that he had an important and melancholy duty to perform that whatever his feelings might be upon the occasion, they must be subservient to the laws of the land, which he did not doubt would be administered with justice and mercy."Acadian Recorder. July 31, 1819 as cited in Cuthbertson, p. 77
Uniacke's only defence was his honour and the honour of his family and, as expected, he was found not guilty. == Gallery == File:RichardJohnUniackeJrMiniatureOnIvory.jpg|[[Richard John Uniacke, Jr.]]- Killed Bowie File:William Bowie, Halifax, Nova Scotia.png|William Bowie, Halifax, Nova Scotia File:William Bowie, Old Burying Ground, Halifax, Nova Scotia.jpg|William Bowie, [[Old Burying Ground (Halifax, Nova Scotia)]] == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bowie, William (merchant)}} [[Category:History of Nova Scotia]] [[Category:1783 births]] [[Category:1819 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian merchants]] [[Category:Duellists]]

{{Unreferenced|date=September 2013}} [[File:Yahia Benmabrouk.jpg|thumb|242x242px|Yahia Benmabrouk in the film: "L'Inspecteur Tahar Marque le But".]] [[File:Hadj Abderrahmane et Yahia Benmabrouk en 1974..jpg|thumb|Hadj Abderrahmane et Yahia Benmabrouk en 1974.]] '''Yahia Benmabrouk''' (1928–2004) is an [[Algeria]]n comedian and film actor, born on March 30 on 1928 in [[Algiers]] and dead on October 8, 2004 in [[Bab El Oued]].
He is best known to the general public for his role of « L’Apprenti » (the apprentice), interpreted in theater, on TV and in films with his friend and associate [[Hadj Abderrahmane]], in “[[inspecteur Tahar|L’inspecteur Tahar]]’s” adventures during the late 60s and 70s. The early death of his companion has somehow taken him away from the art scene.
==Biography== His start in comedy dates from the 1940<nowiki/>s. Quite by chance, he takes the stage to replace ayoung actor who was ill. Their theatrical troupe was composed by young talented comedians who became very quickly famous on the Algerian scene: Hadj Omar, [[Sid-Ali Kouiret]], Allel El-Mouhib, [[Rouiched]] (M. Ayad), Hadj Chérif, Abdelkader Bougaci, M'Guellati and many others. All these actors will form later El Masrah El Djazairi theatrical troupe, directed by [[Mustapha Kateb]]. It was under the latter’s supervision that Yahia Benmabrouk really learned the theatrical art.
In 1956 he was targeted by an attack by a [[Pied-Noir]] extremist group, during the [[Algerian War|Algerian war]] for independence. Traumatized, this attack took him away from the scenes for almost two years; and he left [[Algeria]] for France.However, his stay there would be short-lived because of a very important task. In fact, in early 1958, the [[FLN (Algeria)|FLN]] invited him to join Mohamed Bouzidi H'ssissen, Boualem Rais, Sid Ali Kouiret, Saâdaoui and other artists to form theatrical troupe able to make Algeria famous worldwide and to promote the struggle of the Algerian people freedom.
Yahia Benmabrouk returned to the country by the end of the war and continued to tread the boards among the elements that will constitute the Algerian National Theatre until he retired in the 1980s.
1967 was a decisive year for Yahia Benmabrouk because it marks the birth of the explosive duo: Yahia Ben Mabrouk (L'Apprenti) and Hadj Abderrahmane (L'InspecteurTahar) in the film: « L’Inspecteur Tahar Mène l’Enquète ». And it was followed by many other films.
The tragic death of his friend [[Hadj Abderrahmane]] on October 5, 1981 plunged him into a depression. Nothing will be the same for him.
Yahia Benmabrouk died on October 8, 2004 at the age of 76, in the university hospital of Bab-El-Oued.
==Filmography== * 1967 : ''L’Inspecteur mène l'enquête.'' * 1968 :'' La Souris.'' * 1968 : ''La Poursuite infernale.'' * 1969 : ''L’Auberge du pendu.'' * 1973 : ''Les Vacances de l'inspecteur Tahar.'' * 1977 : ''L'inspecteur marque le but.'' * 1978 : ''Le chat.'' * 1991: ''[[Taxi Mekhfi]].'' * 2000: Les vacances de l'apprenti.
